entry.value:
[{"id":"ST-9","entityId":"64-4975","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"ST"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"9"},{"name":"summary","value":"Implement DatabaseMigrator using cross-platform technology"},{"name":"description","value":"
If we are going to run the DB Server on Linux and macOS, then we will need to be able to install and upgrade the materials database on those platforms, which I think means we will need to run the DatabaseMigrator application.

DatabaseMigrator is written in C#. That in itself is not a show-stopper, because Mono is available for Mac OS. But DatabaseMigrator also depends on a few NuGet packages that might not be available in that environment.

Austyn and I have discussed this. We are leaning towards using C++ and SOCI, the same technology used by DB Server itself.
"},{"name":"created","value":"1488297180566"},{"name":"updated","value":"1533233637597"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"tcrews"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Tim Crews"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"tcrews"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Tim Crews"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"4"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"ST-583","type":"Subtask","role":"parent for"},{"value":"ST-584","type":"Subtask","role":"parent for"},{"value":"ST-585","type":"Subtask","role":"parent for"},{"value":"ST-586","type":"Subtask","role":"parent for"},{"value":"ST-587","type":"Subtask","role":"parent for"},{"value":"ST-632","type":"Subtask","role":"parent for"}]},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"Type","value":["Feature"],"valueId":["Feature"],"color":null},{"name":"State","value":["In Progress"],"valueId":["In Progress"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"tmclachlan","fullName":"Tyler McLachlan"}]},{"name":"Milestone","value":["2018 08 10"],"valueId":["2018 08 10"],"color":null}],"comment":[{"id":"69-14741","author":"tcrews","authorFullName":"Tim Crews","issueId":"ST-9","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Tyler McLachlan will start working on this now. Although he has a YouTrack login, his user name does not appear in the list of available names for the Assignee field.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1527531817180,"updated":1527531827679,"permittedGroup":null,"replies":[]},{"id":"69-14932","author":"wvalentine","authorFullName":"Wendy Valentine","issueId":"ST-9","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Tim Crews Can we turn this into a feature with subtasks to track?
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1528157666576,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"replies":[]},{"id":"69-15163","author":"tcrews","authorFullName":"Tim Crews","issueId":"ST-9","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
This will not actually be done by 6/15, but it does have to be done before the software is deployed. I didn't want this feature to get lost.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1528977826716,"updated":1527531817165,"permittedGroup":null,"replies":[]},{"id":"69-15169","author":"wvalentine","authorFullName":"Wendy Valentine","issueId":"ST-9","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Tim Crews Tyler McLachlan Do we have a timeline on this yet?
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1528990926983,"updated":1528157666576,"permittedGroup":null,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}]

[{"id":"ST-9","entityId":"64-4975","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"ST"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"9"},{"name":"summary","value":"Implement DatabaseMigrator using cross-platform technology"},{"name":"description","value":"
If we are going to run the DB Server on Linux and macOS, then we will need to be able to install and upgrade the materials database on those platforms, which I think means we will need to run the DatabaseMigrator application.

DatabaseMigrator is written in C#. That in itself is not a show-stopper, because Mono is available for Mac OS. But DatabaseMigrator also depends on a few NuGet packages that might not be available in that environment.

Austyn and I have discussed this. We are leaning towards using C++ and SOCI, the same technology used by DB Server itself.
